content.body: Rob Palmer: we can discuss our plans in the editor call today, but even if there are no changes to the editor group, it may still be a good idea to have a vote of confidence and give an opportunity for committee feedback on our modus operandi
content.formatted_body: Rob Palmer: we can discuss our plans in the editor call today, but even if there are no changes to the editor group, it may still be a good idea to have a vote of confidence and give an opportunity for committee feedback on our modus operandi

Rob Palmer: we can discuss our plans in the editor call today, but even if there are no changes to the editor group, it may still be a good idea to have a vote of confidence and give an opportunity for committee feedback on our modus operandi

content.body: Thanks Michael.  In the past, there has been committee feedback for us to spend less plenary time on meta issues such as elections.  So unless there is a specific need for an Editor election, I would suggest not initiating one.  How about raising a Reflector request-for-feedback issue for the Editors?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Thanks Michael.  In the past, there has been committee feedback for us to spend less plenary time on meta issues such as elections.  So unless there is a specific need for an Editor election, I would suggest not initiating one.  How about raising a Reflector request-for-feedback issue for the Editors?

content.body: i agree with the request for comments async approach. we can announce the issue in the next editor updates
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: i agree with the request for comments async approach. we can announce the issue in the next editor updates

content.body: or better yet, an anonymized feedback form
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: or better yet, an anonymized feedback form

content.body: i'd rather not put folks on the spot if they have criticisms, especially in plenary
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: i'd rather not put folks on the spot if they have criticisms, especially in plenary

content.body: instead they should all be given 3 incense sticks that give off distinct colored smoke that represent how pleased they are, they will be asked to form a circle with their backs turned to each other when lighting the incense of their choice
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: instead they should all be given 3 incense sticks that give off distinct colored smoke that represent how pleased they are, they will be asked to form a circle with their backs turned to each other when lighting the incense of their choice

content.body: then we will judge what color the mixed smoke cloud is
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: then we will judge what color the mixed smoke cloud is

content.body: Rob Palmer: I'm fine with that

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Rob Palmer: I'm fine with that

content.body: Rob Palmer: We'd all like to stay on for another year. Can you create an anonymous feedback submission form for us?
content.formatted_body: Rob Palmer: We'd all like to stay on for another year. Can you create an anonymous feedback submission form for us?
